page.title: 17Clifton Airfield : Housing
page.content: The second world war airfield at Clifton is being greatly changed as new houses and an industrial estate are being developed on it. Before any buildings could be put up developers had to solve the problem of drainage and this was done by creating a large man-made lake on the east side of the new development This is now almost complete and the first phase of the housing development is well underway some people have already moved in. This area borders on to Green Lane to the south of the lake.There are 200 2,3 and 4 Bedroomed semi and detached houses and bungalows being built,costs ranging from Â£25000 to Â£48000. Phase 2 is to begin when the Ring Road is built. It is possible that 1000 house could be built altogether with a district centre and a school.
